Definition.WordDefinition: Pulverize \Pul"ver*ize\, v. t. [imp. & p. p. {Pulverized}; p. pr. & vb. n. {Pulverizing}.] [F. pulv['e]riser, L. pulverizare, fr. pulvis dust, powder. See {Powder}.] To reduce of fine powder or dust, as by beating, grinding, or the like; as, friable substances may be pulverized by grinding or beating, but to pulverize malleable bodies other methods must be pursued. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Pulverize \Pul"ver*ize\, v. i. To become reduced to powder; to fall to dust; as, the stone pulverizes easily. [1913 Webster]

pulverize v 1: make into a powder by breaking up or cause to become dust; "pulverize the grains" [syn: {powderize}, {powderise}, {powder}, {pulverise}] 2: destroy completely; "the wrecking ball demolished the building"; "demolish your enemies"; "pulverize the rebellion before it gets out of hand" [syn: {demolish}, {pulverise}] 3: become powder or dust; "When it was blown up, the building powderized" [syn: {powderize}, {pulverise}, {powderise}]
